div.a: Our Food Is Killing Us

div.div: At least 310,000 Americans are annually going to early graves from diet-related conditions—and the FDA doesn’t have the clout or will to help to change it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VRD052&via=Digg&text=Our Food Is Killing Us

div.div: THIS ONE'S FOR YOU, MARISSA MAYER

div.a: For Employee Appreciation Day, A Slideshow Of Commuters Throughout The Decades

div.div: Today the commute to work was hell — and everywhere, every day, it seems to be getting worse. But if anyone out there is laboring under the delusion that there was a Golden Age for commuting, know this: Commuting to work has pretty much always been horrible.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15nEDKS&via=Digg&text=For Employee Appreciation Day, A Slideshow Of Commuters Throughout The Decades

div.a: How Google And Bing Maps Control What You Can See

div.div: Behind the scenes of the most powerful maps in the history of the Earth. And how Google, Microsoft, DigitalGlobe and the world's governments decide what does — and doesn't — belong on its surface.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z390Rb&via=Digg&text=How Google And Bing Maps Control What You Can See

div.a: Your Fitness Tracker Isn't Keeping You Fit

div.div: There’s been an explosion of devices meant to make quantified-selfing easier than ever. All of them promise to help you understand your health and even improve it. That first part? Definitely. The second? Not quite. But it’s coming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12fSi8N&via=Digg&text=Your Fitness Tracker Isn't Keeping You Fit

div.a: Mother Teresa: Anything But A Saint

div.div: Dispelling the myth of altruism and generosity surrounding Mother Teresa.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13tU45J&via=Digg&text=Mother Teresa: Anything But A Saint

div.a: North Korea May Have A Better Version Of Basketball Than The U.S.

div.div: Chinese media report that North Korea has developed its own scoring system for the game.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xnq4n7&via=Digg&text=North Korea May Have A Better Version Of Basketball Than The U.S.

div.div: GLOATING IS STILL COOL THOUGH, RIGHT?

div.a: Is The Age Of The Brag Over?

div.div: If the day of the overshare has passed, and bragging online isn't as fun as it used to be, Facebook may be in for some rough times ahead.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WtrQ9z&via=Digg&text=Is The Age Of The Brag Over?

div.a: Why Everything Looks The Same

div.div: Why do Burger King and McDonald’s start to sell the same salad? There’s a name for that phenomenon.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15nvt0H&via=Digg&text=Why Everything Looks The Same

div.a: A Chair That Self-Destructs After 8 Uses

div.div: A small sensor detects when someone sits and decrements a counter. Every time someone stands up, the chair knocks a number of time to signal how many uses are left.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WklJ6X&via=Digg&text=A Chair That Self-Destructs After 8 Uses

div.a: Big Dog Can Now Throw Cinder Blocks, Thereby Making It The Scariest Robot Ever

div.div: While I’m sure there’s some scientific reason for demonstrating how the quadrupedal Big Dog can pick up and throw cinder blocks across a workshop. I think what we’re seeing here is the first example of a nascent new robotic sport, human tossing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ws49yd&via=Digg&text=Big Dog Can Now Throw Cinder Blocks, Thereby Making It The Scariest Robot Ever

div.a: 9-Year-Old Rapper Lil Poopy Has Been Disowned

div.div: Now that Lil Poopy's biological father is under investigation for child neglect, the MC who played rap-game father figure to the controversial 9-year-old is trying to keep his distance.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15nXVj1&via=Digg&text=9-Year-Old Rapper Lil Poopy Has Been Disowned

div.a: What It's Like Being Verified On Twitter

div.div: Having a verified account is the biggest status symbol in the Twitterverse. Once you're invited, here's the process you have to go through to get one.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vj63PU&via=Digg&text=What It's Like Being Verified On Twitter

div.a: China's Broadcast Of Drug Lord's Final Hours Sparks Controversy

div.div: In a country where executions are so commonplace as to barely rate a mention on the evening news, the death by lethal injection of a drug lord and three accomplices in China on Friday got its own two-hour special on state television.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vj13e9&via=Digg&text=China's Broadcast Of Drug Lord's Final Hours Sparks Controversy

div.a: Larry Flynt's 6 Tips For Porn Stars

div.div: The aging Hustler impresario’s advice: Change studios, avoid agents, be professional -- and "If you don’t really enjoy sex, it’s not for you."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZABjZu&via=Digg&text=Larry Flynt's 6 Tips For Porn Stars

div.div: THAT CARDIGAN IS TO DIE FOR

div.a: J. Crew Catalog Murder Mystery

div.div: It ain’t exactly Agatha Christie, but Meghan O’Neill has figured out that all the models in the J. Crew catalogs that arrive at your house are actually solving murders while trying to sell you cable knit sweaters.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VivWQ3&via=Digg&text=J. Crew Catalog Murder Mystery

div.div: WE'LL GET ANOTHER ROUND OF ROBINS

div.a: Why Superhero Deaths Have Become Meaningless

div.div: Batman’s iconic sidekick just met an untimely end — and fans wonder when he’ll be brought back to life. Why can’t dead superheroes stay dead?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XdM4Ct&via=Digg&text=Why Superhero Deaths Have Become Meaningless

div.a: President Obama Badly Bungles Nerd Reference

div.div: Ultimately, Obama's bungled sci-fi reference will probably not have a major effect on the sequester negotiations, but it may lose him some of the nerd street cred he'd attained from his Reddit AMA.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15nJ0Wh&via=Digg&text=President Obama Badly Bungles Nerd Reference

div.a: Game Theory

div.div: Why an experimental video game is more anticipated than Sony's Playstation 4.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/147p9bc&via=Digg&text=Game Theory

div.a: How To Spend 47 Hours On A Train And Not Go Crazy

div.div: On a train trip across America, incredible subcultures take shape. Then vanish.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XK7fIA&via=Digg&text=How To Spend 47 Hours On A Train And Not Go Crazy

div.a: Rap Genius Annotates Andrew Mason's Farewell Memo To Groupon

div.div: "Groupon stock shot up 12% when they fired the homie."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15nSFMv&via=Digg&text=Rap Genius Annotates Andrew Mason's Farewell Memo To Groupon

div.a: The Beautiful Inside Story Of How Search Works
@mat
9h ago

div.div: Remember when infographics were meant to help you understand, not just make numbers pretty? This gets back to that google.com/insidesearch/ho...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yc6AC0&via=Digg&text=The Beautiful Inside Story Of How Search Works

div.a: Why Do We Hate Donald Trump So Much?

div.div: Donald Trump is the perfect icon for a media landscape consumed with narcissism.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XI2ylU&via=Digg&text=Why Do We Hate Donald Trump So Much?

div.a: Pregnancy Permanently Changes Foot Size

div.div: A new University of Iowa study confirms what many women have long suspected – that pregnancy permanently changes the size and shape of a woman's feet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VSJRLw&via=Digg&text=Pregnancy Permanently Changes Foot Size

div.a: Watch This Animated Synesthesia Simulation

div.div: Synesthesia is a neurological disorder (and/or gift depending on worldview) in which your five senses sometimes seem to have their wires crossed — you can hear color, see sound, so on and so forth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XphV1u&via=Digg&text=Watch This Animated Synesthesia Simulation

div.a: How To Take A Bath And Other Vintage Visual Guides From The Early 1900s

div.div: The history of health is peppered with gorgeous anatomical flap-ups, strange medical art, and vibrant vintage illustrations, with a side of beautifully illustrated pseudoscience. But few come close to these vintage gems.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YMDLx4&via=Digg&text=How To Take A Bath And Other Vintage Visual Guides From The Early 1900s

div.a: Charge Your Cell Phone In 5 Seconds

div.div: Supercapacitors: They'll enable you to charge your cell phone in 5 seconds, or an electric car in about a minute. They're cheap, biodegradable, never wear out and could be powering your life sooner than you'd think.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VSzbN0&via=Digg&text=Charge Your Cell Phone In 5 Seconds

div.div: THE PRICE OF A ZOMBIE-NINJA WAR

div.a: Five-Year-Old Runs Up $2,500 iPad Bill In Ten Minutes

div.div: "It was a good game, but I will never do anything like this again. I'm banned from the iPad now, but I am still going to play games when I can, but I will be careful now."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15mGkbi&via=Digg&text=Five-Year-Old Runs Up $2,500 iPad Bill In Ten Minutes
